job_title: Desktop Support Specialist in Canandaigua, NY
pros: You get fulfilment while working with people.
cons: It is a public job, this means that the benefits make up the majority of the difference in pay.

review_title: A Pretty Okay Place to Work
job_title: Professional Writing Tutor in Canandaigua, NY
pros: Casual work environment Great Students Great Coworkers Flexible hours

job_title: Daycare Assistant Teacher in Canandaigua, NY
pros: Community, Teamwork, Collaboration, working with children

cons: Leadership can be a little uncertain but it doesn't impact most of the offices.

pros: Direct coworkers were great. Place is unionized.
cons: Administration has no idea what's going on. Sexual harassment is ignored and allowed.

review_title: Creative freedom and the chance to improve peoples lives
pros: This is a college where grass roots ideas on how to improve student success are valued and allowed to come to fruition. Faculty jobs allow for a lot of flexibility.
cons: Pay is not great for a single-income household. You will have to teach overloads to get a decent paycheck.

job_title: Associate Vice President for Student Affairs in Canandaigua, NY
pros: Dedicated and amazing employees make this a wonderful place to work.
cons: Diminishing enrollment makes it fiscally difficult to be creative.

pros:
Great collaborative environment
Good Online accessibility
cons: Low hours available although good flexibility

job_title: Graphic Designer in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Great people, experience and flexibility while enrolled in college.

This was a good opportunity for me as a student to get a taste of what office work was like. I was given enough responsibilities to feel needed and to feel like a contributing part of the office. I was not given so much responsibility that I felt overwhelmed by what was expected of me. I would recommend working in the Student Accounts office for any student at FLCC who wants work place experience.
cons: It can become a little stale at times. Very tedious work. You will have to be social with the other employees in the office if you want to enjoy your time working there.

review_title: Resident Assistant - Office of Housing and Residential Life
pros:
- Excellent opportunity to grow as a person while enjoying free housing.
- The best team experience I have ever had
- Excellent management
- Personal attention as an employee
- Learned many vital skills
- Your team will become your family
cons:
- Very considerable competition
- low pay, but as a student housing costs are huge, and housing is free. (If you can prove you can handle the workload, you will be able to work outside of the position)
- Must be able to handle considerable emotional stress
- Must be able to remain calm in emergency situations, you will deal with any possible situation from attempted suicide, fire, floods, crime, drug overdoses, shooting threats.

review_title: The time I spent at Finger Lakes Community College was very rewarding and fulfilling.
pros: The people were all very friendly and helpful.
cons: I really do not have any cons to speak of.

pros: Great salary and benefits. Opportunities for growth
cons: Some offices are very isolated from rest of the campus so there are very  limited opportunities to meet faculty and other staff. There is not much diversity amongst faculty and staff.

pros: People are very helpful, training is in-depth, and great balance between job and class work.
cons: Many positions through work study are only minimum wage.

pros: best reasons to work there are good facilities
cons: downsides to working there are the distance to commute

pros: The people that I work with are amazing!
cons: I need a full time job.

pros: The benefits and not much else.
cons: Disappointing, I have been here 4 years, thought the new president will a positive change. Not at all.  I agree with a previous post, if the tax payers only know how their money is spent.
Temporary position. No long term work.
